intro: Pfosseria, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to various regions in Europe and Asia, often thriving in woodland or rocky habitats. Pfosseria species typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, clustered flowers. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
